faculties_accepted: Geneva School of Economics and Management
School of Social Sciences (Sciences De la Société)
module_restrictions: Students must restrict their choice of courses to 2 faculties (+ Intensive French courses). Bachelor students cannot access master courses.
visa_info: Non-EU citizens may require a visa and must contact the nearest Swiss embassy 3 months before entering Switzerland. Some visas can take as long as 3 months. A valid health and accident insurance is obligatory to reside in Switzerland.
accommodations_info: Students can register online for university accommodation at the Cité Universitaire de Genève. Rooms are allocated on a first-come-first-served basis.
university_description: The University of Geneva is a public research university located in Geneva, Switzerland. It was founded in 1559 by John Calvin as a theological seminary and law school.
location_cost_of_living: Geneva is known as a very expensive city, with high costs for housing, food, and transportation.
location_weather: Geneva has a temperate climate with warm summers and cool winters. The warmest month is July and the coldest month is January. Geneva receives a moderate amount of precipitation throughout the year.
location_description: Geneva is a global city and a center for diplomacy, with the European headquarters of the United Nations and many international organizations located there. It is known for its beautiful scenery, museums, and cultural events.
location_transportation: Geneva has an extensive public transportation system including buses, trams, and trains. The public transportation system is efficient and reliable.
location_halal: There are many halal food options available in Geneva, including restaurants and grocery stores.
location_vegetarian: There are many vegetarian food options available in Geneva, including restaurants and grocery stores.
